title: Last universal common ancestor
summary: The last universal common ancestor or last universal cellular ancestor (LUCA), also called the last universal ancestor (LUA), is the most recent population of organisms from which all organisms now living on Earth have a common descentâ€”the most recent common ancestor of all current life on Earth.[1] A related concept is that of progenote.[2][3][4] LUCA is not thought to be the first life on Earth, but rather the latest that is ancestral to all current existing life.
